intro: Macleania costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican macleania, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
